timeline.bodyText: Remove changes not related to this PR
timeline.author: sujithvm

timeline.bodyText: Can you verify these are the same labels we have?
timeline.author: sujithvm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@
+# Configuration for Release Drafter: https://github.com/toolmantim/release-drafter
+template: |
+  <!-- Optional: add a release summary here -->
+  $CHANGES
+
+name-template: $NEXT_MINOR_VERSION
+tag-template: $NEXT_MINOR_VERSION
+# Uses a more common 2-digit versioning in Jenkins plugins. Can be replaced by semver: $MAJOR.$MINOR.$PATCH
+version-template: $MAJOR.$MINOR
+
+# Emoji reference: https://gitmoji.carloscuesta.me/
+categories:
+  - title: "Breaking changes"
+    label: "breaking change"
+
+  - title: "Features"
+    label: "feature"
+
+  - title: "Enhancements"
+    label: "enhancements"
+
+  - title: "Bug Fixes"
+    labels: "bug fix"

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: cliu123

timeline.bodyText: Can you confirm we need this trigger on pull_request? I don't see the requirement on the official docs or general usage as well.
timeline.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: We normally don't do push on master branch, but I added this just in case anybody having authorization to push on master and really doing it.
replies.author: cliu123

replies.bodyText: We do push on master branch.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: Do we need it on every push or pull? Don't we need this only on the release or release candidate tag?
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText:
Do we need it on every push or pull? Don't we need this only on the release or release candidate tag?

@vrozov Line #6 and #7 just intends to log the changes pushed on master. If we don't have to track those changes, I'll remove this.
replies.author: cliu123

replies.bodyText: This is github workflow/action definition file and it defines when action is triggered. I don't think it is necessary to trigger release draft action on every PR or push to the master. IMO, that should be merged into CD workflow.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: It'll be triggered on the PRs only when they get merged to master branch, not all PRs. I thought that release notes intend to track all changes merged/pushed to master branch(Please correct me if I'm wrong), which is why the action gets triggered up on PR merge and commit push on master branch.
replies.author: cliu123

replies.bodyText: I do see it running on your PR that suggests that it will be triggered on every PR and every PR merge. Unless I miss something, I don't see why this is necessary and why it can't run only as part of CD.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: There was a miscommunication. I should say that the release note gets updated only when PRs get merged to master branch or commits get pushed on master branch. The action runs on other PRs, but it stops nearly immediately without updating release notes at all.
replies.author: cliu123

replies.bodyText: It is not necessary to update release notes each time PR is merged. It is also not necessary to run the action on PR update (whether it exits without updating release notes or not).
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: I'm fine with not triggerd the action up on PR updates. I've removed that trigger. But I believe that the action should be triggerd when PRs get merged to master. Otherwise, it wouldn't update release notes with the merge PRs.
replies.author: cliu123

replies.bodyText: pull_request event is triggered when pull request is created against a branch and not when it is merged. You will have to specifically check for pull request closed and merged events but not needed here
replies.author: sujithvm

timeline.bodyText: Please refer to Alerting plugin https://github.com/opendistro-for-elasticsearch/alerting/blob/master/.github/draft-release-notes-config.yml so that we can have consistency across the release notes.
timeline.author: sujithvm

timeline.bodyText:
We don't follow this versioning style. We have 4 parts to semantic versioning.
Also remove any unnecessary comments
timeline.author: sujithvm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@
+# Configuration for Release Drafter: https://github.com/toolmantim/release-drafter
+template: |
+  <!-- Optional: add a release summary here -->
+  $CHANGES
+
+name-template: $NEXT_MINOR_VERSION
+tag-template: $NEXT_MINOR_VERSION
+# Uses a more common 2-digit versioning in Jenkins plugins. Can be replaced by semver: $MAJOR.$MINOR.$PATCH
+version-template: $MAJOR.$MINOR

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: cliu123

timeline.message: Add Release Drafter action to workflow AND add a configuration file for Release Drafter.
Add Release Drafter action to workflow AND add a configuration file for Release Drafter.

timeline.author: vrozov
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+name: Release-drafter
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches: [master]
+  pull_request:
+    branches: [master]
+
+jobs:
+  update_release_draft:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      # Drafts the next Release notes as Pull Requests are merged into "master"
+      - uses: release-drafter/release-drafter@v5
+        with:
+          config-name: release-drafter-config.yml
+        env:
+          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: cliu123

timeline.bodyText: Is this a newly added label? I see two labels bug and bug fix.
timeline.author: vrozov
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
+# Configuration for Release Drafter: https://github.com/toolmantim/release-drafter
+template: |
+  Compatible with Elasticsearch (set version here).
+  $CHANGES
+
+# Setting the formatting and sorting for the release notes body
+name-template: Version (set version here)
+change-template: '* $TITLE (#$NUMBER)'
+sort-by: merged_at
+sort-direction: ascending
+
+# Organizing the tagged PRs into unified ODFE categories
+categories:
+  - title: "Enhancements"
+    labels: "enhancement"
+
+  - title: "Bug fixes"
+    labels: "bug fix"

replies.bodyText: Yes, I added "bug fix" label in order to correctly categorize "Bug fixes" PRs in release notes.
replies.author: cliu123

replies.bodyText: How is it different from the existing bug label? Why do we need a new label?
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: The bug label is to categorize issues. But this 'bug fix' label is for PRs.
replies.author: cliu123

replies.bodyText: Why the same label can't be used for both? IMO, it is very confusing and hard to remember which one should be used for issues and which one for PRs.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: "bug" is described as "Somthing isn't working" on the label itself, which indicates a category of issues. But "bug fix" intuitively express that it is a type of fixes, which doesn't confuse at all. And typing in the "labels" search bar will auto-completes the labels, which users can easily choose 'bug' or 'bug fixes'. However, if you strongly insist that there's no need for a new label, I can change it.
replies.author: cliu123

replies.bodyText: I don't think such distinction is necessary. bug on the PR can't mean that PR introduces a bug, it already means that PR fixes a bug. I also checked few other projects (guava and elasticsearch) and I don't think that they do such distinction. Not as part of this PR, but it will be good to adopt a better labelling scheme (for example similar to guava) and change bug to defect.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: That's fine. I've removed 'bug fix' label and updated the PR to use 'bug' label to recognize the 'Bug fixes' PRs.
replies.author: cliu123

timeline.message: Add a new line at the end of file release-drafter.yml

timeline.author: vrozov
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+name: Release-drafter
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches: [master]
+  pull_request:
+    branches: [master]
+
+jobs:
+  update_release_draft:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      # Drafts the next Release notes as Pull Requests are merged into "master"
+      - uses: release-drafter/release-drafter@v5
+        with:
+          config-name: release-drafter-config.yml

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: cliu123

timeline.message: Avoid triggering the Release Drafter action upon PR updates.
Avoid triggering the Release Drafter action upon PR updates.
Removing 'bug fix' label and using 'bug' label to categorize 'Bug fixes' PRs

timeline.author: vrozov

timeline.message:
Update .github/release-notes-drafter-config.yml

Update the "change-template" to include the link to the PR.

Co-authored-by: Vlad Rozov <vrozov@users.noreply.github.com>
